column4: hi guys, how can i shared files between ubuntu and ubuntu using LAN?
sftp/scp is the easiest..  apt-get install openssh-server on both sides..
in naultilus do a sftp://<username>@ipaddress:/home/<username>
: more detail please
openssh is a secure shell / file transfer system.    you will need to install openssh-server on both systems..
: okay please wait
once you got it installed, you can go into nautilus and type "sftp://username@ipaddress:/home/username/" in the location bar and it should connect.
: how can i know the ip addresss?
I ussually open a shell and type "ifconfig"
: sth like 192.168.1.2 or else?
yeah.. thats looks about right for something on the backside of a internet router thing.
need to know the ip of the machine your going to connect to.
: okay, what's next?
once you know the IP's on both sides..
open up nautilus (the file browser thing in gnome)
: then?
you see the location bar?
: yes
type this into it: sftp://<remote machines IP>
should prompt for some stuff..   and ask for a username/password
: wait, sth going wrong. i can't see the folder on the other computer, only my computer
put in the right IP address.. maybe you told it to connect to your self..
